meanings.definition: Capable of being made or created.
meanings.sent1: The simple ingredients made the cake makable for even a beginner baker.
meanings.sent2: The new toy was easily makable with the included instructions.
meanings.sent3: The makable puzzle was completed in record time by the young child.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming an astronaut felt more makable after attending space camp.
meanings.sent5: The makable costume was a hit at the school play.

meanings.definition: Able to be produced or manufactured.
meanings.sent1: The small workshop was able to create makable wooden toys for the local market.
meanings.sent2: The factory had the capacity to produce makable cars at a rapid pace.
meanings.sent3: The makable clothing line became popular due to its unique designs.
meanings.sent4: His idea for a new app seemed more makable after receiving funding.
meanings.sent5: The makable furniture was in high demand due to its durability.
